boundedBuffer

Class BufferSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • boundedBuffer.BufferSystem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class BufferSystem
extends java.lang.Thread
    Sets up and runs a buffer, producer and consumer.
    Version:
    January 2020
    Author:
    Hugh Osborne

    • Method Detail

      • readDelayArgument

        private static double readDelayArgument(java.lang.String argument)
                                 throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Attempt to parse a producer/consumer delay argument. These can be "fast", "medium", "slow", or a (string representation of) a double value representing the delay in seconds.
        Parameters:
        argument - the delay specification
        Returns:
        the delay, in seconds, specified by the argument
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the argument is not one of the predefined specifiers and is also not a validly formatted double value.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Start up a producer and a consumer. A call of main can have up to four arguments. The first argument should be an integer specifying the size of the buffer. If this argument is missing, or if it is not an integer, the default value of 10 is used. The second argument should be a floating point number specifying the number of seconds the buffer is to stay open for. If this argument is missing, or if it is not an integer, the default value of 20 is used. The remaining two arguments should be floating point numbers, specifying maximum delays to be applied to the producer and consumer, thereby affecting their speeds. The first delay is applied to the producer, the second to the consumer. The delays can be specified as "fast", "medium", or "slow", in which case the corresponding predefined values are used, or as a double specifying the delay in seconds.
        Parameters:
        args - the command line arguments for this class. There should be four of these - in order:
        • the size of the buffer,
        • the length of time (in seconds) the system is to run
        • the delay to be applied to the producer
        • the delay to be applied to the consumer
